de.esoco.lib.comm.http

Interface HttpRequestHandler.HttpRequestMethodHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ObjectSpaceHttpMethodHandler
    Enclosing class:
    HttpRequestHandler
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public static interface HttpRequestHandler.HttpRequestMethodHandler
    An interface for the handling of the distinct HTTP request methods. It is a functional interface so only the method doGet(HttpRequest) needs to be implemented for basic GET request functionality. But implementors can also implement support for other requests methods like POST, PUT, and DELETE if necessary. The default implementations for this methods always throw an UnsupportedOperationException. If other request methods need to be supported the implementation may also override the method handleMethod(HttpRequest) which switches over the HttpRequestMethod and throws a HTTP status code exception on unsupported request methods.

    The handling of request methods is intended to be stateless so that a single instance should be able to handle multiple requests. The state that is associated with the handling of a particular request is stored in the associated Server.RequestHandler instance and will be handed to the request method handler in the HttpRequest argument of the methods below.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default HttpResponse doDelete(HttpRequest rRequest)
      Must be overridden to support the DELETE request method.
      HttpResponse doGet(HttpRequest rRequest)
      This method must be always be implemented to provide the basic functionality in the form of GET requests.
      default HttpResponse doPost(HttpRequest rRequest)
      Must be overridden to support the POST request method.
      default HttpResponse doPut(HttpRequest rRequest)
      Must be overridden to support the PUT request method.
      default HttpResponse handleMethod(HttpRequest rRequest)
      Creates the response for the current request and returns a Reader that provides the data of the response body.

      • handleMethod

        default HttpResponse handleMethod(HttpRequest rRequest)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the response for the current request and returns a Reader that provides the data of the response body.
        Parameters:
        rRequest - rRequest eRequestMethod The request method to create the response for
        Returns:
        A HttpResponse object containing relations with the response data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading or writing data fails
